I am instructed to warn you to be careful what 
                                                                           78
manner of spirit you manifest in regard to enlarging and perfecting the school work, for you are not to suppose that, unaided, you are equal to the task of carrying forward the increasing work that you have begun.  Create no dissension by unadvised words of criticism in regard to the course of others, even if some things which displease you may seem to have been unnecessarily done.  It makes me sad to think that you have become discontented over trivial matters.  -- Letter 63, 1902.
